@PriscillaLynch @IvanYatesNT Happier now that ICGP and ICOG seem to be more accurately representing members concerns and fears. We all want a quality service asap rather than a rapidly delivered one with serious flaws. All Docs and Nurses want the best for our patients.

@freesafelegal @ivanabacik @Lawyers4Choice We don't want any unnecessary delay but we need to get it right. A world class service should be the aspiration. Unrealistic expectations have already been driven by many and a touch of realism is needed. Fail to prepare, prepare to fail.
@alisonoconn @FitzgeraldFrncs To be fair the work and attitude of all out politicians in the Dail and Seanad is streets ahead of the behavior in Westminster.

@ArtimusFoul @therealboycee That is a real worry for many.
@Antcon7062 Many good people but the system is getting nastier and more vindictive.
@neasaconneally Did an 84 hour one once. Had to drive home after and recall arriving at my house but none of the actual drive.
@colmtobin Or we could take them in for a few hours every second weekend?
@keelinodonoghue @campaignforleo A graduated roll out focusing on quality and safety would seem far better than what @SimonHarrisTD is pushing.

@glenmore888 Time, training, USS access, lack of care pathways for complications, indemnity concerns (HSE ask providers to indemnify them), over work and burnout with present work load and unreasonable expectations being driven.
@Antcon7062 @CiaranORiain I feel some will only be happy once vunerable doctors take their own lives. Frightening lack of any semblence of a duty of care.
@glenmore888 @IverHanrahanGP @anitambyrne @drbriankennedy Very few at all are blaming FEMPI
@anitambyrne Sometimes the mute function is tge best answer for trolls ...
@anitambyrne Safety and quality of care are not your priorities and tbh am a bit sick of your uninformed attacks or GPs for not doing something they are not trained or qualified for. Goodnight.

@anitambyrne I can provide high quality service in things I am trained and qualified to do. I can also refer people for services that can be done better by others. Like most GPs I do not feel I can provide a quality TOP service at this time with the resources at hand.
@anitambyrne @WHO WHO says it can safely be done in the community by properly trained Doctors and midwives, it says nothing about GPs.

@anitambyrne Some women will continue to buy them online, that does not mean we should settle for a poor quality service. High quality accessible service is what I want for patients, am sorry you do not share that view.
@anitambyrne Just because you want it doesnt mean it is safe or that it can happen. Sometimes we just have to grow up and realise that.
@keelinodonoghue Peter Boylan for all his qualities is pushing for a service before it can be done properly and safely.
@IverHanrahanGP @anitambyrne @glenmore888 @drbriankennedy Obviously you want women to die from cancer if you dont provide colposcopy services in your clinic either.
@anitambyrne You seem to want a free for all, little better than buying online abortion pills.
@anitambyrne How did you make that jump? Dont support any meds being bought online, antidepressents, viagra, benzos, steroids, strychnine all of which have seen bought
@anitambyrne Majority of GPs do not feel GP is tge best place for this service and Majority of gynaecologists do not believe we are ready or prepared to launch an service on jan 1st.
@anitambyrne And the utter bollocks I'm spreading is also supported by the majority of GPs and the majority of Gynaecologists. You obviously know more than we do.....

@anitambyrne Ensuring a service is safe is not scaremongering. We have a history of starting services with inadequate supports and resources. Not sure why you want GPs to do something majority dont think they are qualified to do. And no one is refusing to help women in crisis.
@anitambyrne Utter bollocks, making simplistic comments like that shows a complete lack of both emphathy and understanding. Safe and quality service is better than a poor one delivered by everyone.
@ipvenner @drg1985 @ciarakellydoc That is the Medical council in Ireland acting not the GMC, they are the one that controls the UK where she is working now.

@drg1985 @ciarakellydoc And if genuine concerns why did they not contact GMC in confidence and ask them to act? No need to publish name and address of someone claimed to be unwell with mental health issues.

@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice Dates confirmed by USS
@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice Most women know their dates but some unsure esp if irreg cycle, on OCP or simply can't recall.
@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice Dates and refer for USS. USS for dating routinely done but only at approx 14 weeks (done in hosp).
@Berlinnaeus He's not still going is he?
@Bangordub What'd he say?

@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice Where are you going with this? If you want to check the medical syllabus and GP training syllabus you can look it up yourself ! Checking pregnancy is done as an undergrad and also again in GP training.
@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice It's considered a speciality or at least a subspeciality role.
@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice It's just not part of routine doctors or GP's training.
@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice Not curettage or but have LARC and limited USS training. None would be routinely done in training in the past at least.
@DUPleader So what do you propose as an alternative?

@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice They should either have USS on site or have rapid access it, they should either be able to do an curettage onsite or have rapid access to it and they should ideally be able to do LARC insertion and STI screening.
@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice What do you mean GP lead clinic?

@susannormaokee1 @Doctors4Choice In Ireland up to now we can do nothing. In the rest of Europe they refer to a specialist clinic.
